channel.title: Screwed up my HDD
channel.description: So yea, I was attempting to uninstall Ubuntu (yea, I know, I won't get any sympathy from MITB) to make some space for a Leopard image I want to install on my new PC, so I changed the partition size of Ubuntu, which screwed up the MBR or GRUB. I'm not exactly sure. Now my HDD is trashed. Is there any way for me to recover any readable information on the disk?

item.title: Screwed up my HDD
item.dc:creator: @xxlegitxx xxlegitxx
item.description:
@xxlegitxx wrote:

Schizzo:

It would be great if we knew what error message you were getting (if you are getting one). Just saying that your hard drive is screwed isn’t really a lot of helpful information.

I actually got it fixed. So thank you, but no thank you.

Read full topic

Windows installation disks fixed mine once

item.title: Screwed up my HDD

item.description:
@xxlegitxx wrote:

Fixmbr and fixboot didn’t help, I tried. But thanks.

Read full topic

item.title: Screwed up my HDD
item.dc:creator: @killerman93 killerman93
item.description:
@killerman93 wrote:

xxlegitxx:

So yea, I was attempting to uninstall Ubuntu (yea, I know, I won’t get any sympathy from MITB) to make some space for a Leopard image I want to install on my new PC, so I changed the partition size of Ubuntu, which screwed up the MBR or GRUB. I’m not exactly sure. Now my HDD is trashed. Is there any way for me to recover any readable information on the disk?

I accidentally did this, if your PC has a manafacturer, use the windows recovery disk, go on the command prompt and type:

fixMBR

And then:

fixboot

I did this when I deleted Ubuntu, glad I could help.

Read full topic

item.title: Screwed up my HDD
item.dc:creator: @kloplop321 kloplop321
item.description:
@kloplop321 wrote:

writes down for future reference

well all I would like a program is restoring the File Allocation Table on hard drive as the table was corrupted from installing once.

For your information, once your uninstall and delete the partition of Linux, you need to repair the MBR partition info so windows can once more boot up. otherwise it is “just” data.

Since you are installing OSX, you just need the hard drive in a format that could be re-allocated

Read full topic

item.title: Screwed up my HDD
item.dc:creator: @xxlegitxx xxlegitxx
item.description:
@xxlegitxx wrote:

Wow.

If ANYONE needs to recover data that is on an apparently corrupted HDD, get Stellar Phoenix. 10 MB download, but extremely powerful.

Read full topic

@xxlegitxx wrote:

item.title: Screwed up my HDD
item.dc:creator: @Rictoo Rictoo
item.description:
@Rictoo wrote:

Use the Knoppix livecd and use the app called ‘testdisk’ and fix your partition tables (it will work for sure).

Read full topic
